question: Who was a very good-natured little fellow, and did his duties so willingly and well that everybody liked him?
answer1: a little page-boy
answer4: A little page-boy

question: Where did the little page-boy work?
answer1: the Castle
answer4: A stately Castle

question: Who did the little page-boy serve?
answer1: the great Earl
answer4: The Great Earl

question: Why did the Castle have a little postern that that opened to a narrow flight of steps?
answer1: Anyone who liked could go down there in the pleasant summer mornings and bathe in the shimmering sea.
answer4: So that anyone who liked could go down to the sea shore

question: Why was the little page-boy very fond of going out on this moor?
answer1: He could run about as much as he liked, chasing bumble-bees, and catching butterflies, and looking for birds' nests when it was nesting time.
answer4: He could run about as much as he liked

question: Why did the bulter allow the little page-boy to go out on this moor?
answer1: He knew that it was good for a healthy little lad to have plenty of fun in the open air.
answer4: He knew that it was good for a healthy little lad to have plenty of fun in the open air

question: What was the warning the butler gave to the little page-boy?
answer1: keep far away from the Fairy Knowe
answer4: Keep far away from the Fairy Knowe

question: Why did the butler want the little page-boy to stay away from the Fairy Knowe?
answer1: The little Folk should not be trusted.
answer4: The Little Folk are not to trust

question: Who would punish any rash mortal who came too near them?
answer1: the Fairies
answer4: Fairies

question: What did the country people do to avoid going too near the Fairy Knowe?
answer1: walk a good half-mile out of their way
answer4: Walk a good half-mile out of their way

question: Why didn't the country people go to the moor at night?
answer1: Everyone knows that Fairies come abroad in the darkness, and the door of their dwelling stands open, so that any luckless mortal who does not take care may find himself inside.
answer4: Fairies come abroad in the darkness

question: Why was the little page-boy anxious to see the Fairies?
answer1: The little page-boy was an adventurous wight.
answer4: He was an adventurous wright

question: What did the little page-boy want to do at the Fairy Knowe?
answer1: see them, and to visit their abode, just to find out what it was like
answer4: Visit their abode, just to find out what it was like

question: What did the little page-boy do one night when everyone was asleep?
answer1: crept out of the Castle by the little postern door, and stole down the stone steps, and along the sea shore, and up on to the moor, and went straight to the Fairy Knowe
answer4: He krept out of the Castle

question: How will the little page-boy feel when he reaches the Fairy Knowe?
answer1: delight
answer4: Adventurous

question: How did the little page-boy feel when he slipped inside the Knowe?
answer1: excited
answer4: Delighted

question: Why was the little page-boy delighted?
answer1: He found that what everyone said was true.
answer4: The top of the Knowe was tipped up and from the opening that was thus made, rays of light came streaming out

question: Who did the little page-boy see after he slipped inside the Knowe?
answer1: the Tiny Folk, Fairies, and Elves, and Gnomes
answer4: Scores of Tiny Folk, Fairies, and Elves and Gnomes

question: What did the little page-boy do after he came into a large room?
answer1: stood in a dark corner watching the busy scene in wonder, thinking how strange it was that there should be such a number of these tiny beings living their own lives all unknown to men
answer4: He stood in a dark corner watching the busy scene in wonder

question: What did the two Fairy Pages do after someone gave an order?
answer1: darted from the table to a tiny cupboard in the rock, and returned staggering under the weight of a most beautiful silver cup, richly embossed and lined inside with gold
answer4: They darted from the table to a tiny cupboard in the rock, and returned staggering under the weight of a most beautiful silver cup

question: What did the Fairies do after the cup was placed on the table?
answer1: began to drink out of it in turn
answer4: All the fairies began to drink out of it in turn

question: What did the little page-boy notice?
answer1: no one poured wine into it, and yet it was always full, and that the wine that was in it was not always the same kind
answer4: No one poured wine into it and yet it was always full

question: What did each Fairy do after they grasped its stem?
answer1: wished for the wine that he loved best
answer4: Wish for the win that he loved best

question: What will happen after the little page-boy takes the cup?
answer1: The Fairies will chase him.
answer4: He will bring it back and show it to the Earl

question: What did the little page boy want to do after watching the Fairies drink from the cup?
answer1: take the cup home with him
answer4: Take the cup back to the castle

question: How will the Fairies feel when they see the little page-boy?
answer1: pleased
answer4: Surprised

question: What will the Fairies do when they see the little page-boy ?
answer1: invite him to a seat at the table
answer4: They will trick him

question: What will happen after the Fairies ask the little page-boy to sit down at the table?
answer1: They will grow rude and insolent.
answer4: They will make fun of him for serving mortals

question: How were the Fairies rude to the little page-boy?
answer1: jeered at him for being content to serve mere mortals, telling him that they saw everything that went on at the Castle, and making fun of the old butler
answer4: They jeered at him for being content to serve mere mortals

question: Why couldn't the little page-boy stand their teasing remarks any longer?
answer1: They laughed at the food he ate.
answer4: They made fun of the butler and the food that he ate
answer5: He knew that if he wanted to secure the cup he must not lose anymore time

question: What happened after the little page-boy grabbed the stem of the cup?
answer1: the ruby wine was turned to clear cold water.
answer4: The ruby wine was turned to clear cold water

question: Why did the ruby wine turn into clear cold water?
answer1: The little page boy wished for water.
answer2: The little page boy wanted water.
answer4: They boy wished it to be water
answer5: They boy said "I'll drink to you all in water"

question: Why didn't the little page-boy drink from the cup?
answer1: He threw the water over the candles.
answer4: He threw the water over the candles

question: How did the little page-boy feel after the Fairies teased him?
answer1: angry
answer4: Angry

question: What did the little page-boy do after he threw the water over the candles?
answer1: clasped the precious cup tightly in his arms, he sprang to the opening of the Knowe
answer4: Then, clasping the precious cup tighly in his arms, he sprang to the opening of the Knowe

question: How will the Fairies feel after the little page-boy threw water over the candles?
answer1: angry
answer4: They were wild with rage

question: What did the Fairies do after the little page-boy took the cup?
answer1: chased him
answer4: Chase after him

question: How did the little page-boy feel after he realized the Fairies were chasing him?
answer1: scared
answer4: Very afraid

question: What happened after the little page-boy believed he could not escape?
answer1: A mysterious voice helped him.
answer2: A mysterious voice told him where to go.
answer4: A voice said "If you would gain the Castle door, Keep to the black stones on the shore"

question: Who had been taken prisoner by the Fairies and did not want a like fate to befall the adventurous page-boy?
answer1: a poor mortal
answer4: Some poor mortal

question: Why did the little page-boy run to the shore?
answer1: A voice told him.
answer4: He had once heard that if anyone walked on the wet sands, where the waves had come over them, the Fairies could not touch him

question: What happened after the little page-boy reached the shore?
answer1: He was safe from the Fairies.
answer4: The little Fold could go no step further

question: How did the Fairies feel after the little page-boy reached the shore?
answer1: angry
answer4: Rage and disappointment

question: Why couldn't the Fairies chase after the little page-boy anymore?
answer1: He walked on the wet sands.
answer4: He was protected by the wet sand

question: What did the little page-boy do before the Fairies were about to lay hands on him?
answer1: jumped across the water-mark on to the firm, wet sand
answer4: He jumped across the water-mark on to the firm, wet sand

question: What did the little page-boy do after he escaped from the Fairies?
answer1: ran safely along the shore, his precious cup in his arms, and climbed lightly up the steps in the rock and disappeared through the postern
answer4: Ran safey along the shore, his precious cup in his arms and climbed lightly up the steps in the rock and disappeared through the Postern

question: What did the little page-boy do many years later?
answer1: had grown up and become a stately butler, who trained other little page-boys to follow in his footsteps
answer4: Become a stately butler, who trained other little page-boys
